comment: Great professor and a pure joy to attend this class! Some of the major assignments are extremely close in due dates but not impossible to handle. Get through the first half of the semester and the second half is a breeze! Two essays and a mapping project. Mini quizzes. Awesome class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Her class was fun and genuinely interesting. She makes it easy to talk in front of other students. She cares about the students' interests and will try her best to incorporate modern music, words, and books into her class. Absolutely loved her. I wish she could teach all of my classes. You MUST take her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Linda Stewart is an amazing professor, the best I've taken at KSU. She makes the class exciting and interesting. She really cares about her students and always encourages discussions. She is so inspirational, I highly recommend her to anyone who needs another English class for credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: I loved this class! Professor Stewart makes all the material very interesting and applicable to life today. She is such a sweet woman and seems to genuinely care for her students. Most of the work is interesting and fairly easy. I wish she could teach every class. Absolutely take a class with her if you can!

Professor Stewart was amazing, great class. I actually enjoyed going to her class. If youre thinking about taking ENGL 2122. Hurry up and sign up for this class before all the spots are taken up. Best Professor ever.

Possibly the sweetest woman ever! She cares so much about her job and her students! Class is an easy A if you show up and pay attention. Little bit of reading but nothing too much! Take her if you get the chance! Such a sweetheart 3

She is so helpful, and always there to provide feedback. Her quizzes were very tough, but it is still an easy A or B even if you bomb a couple. She saved my grade and would always go over my rough draft and give me some ideas to go on.

Took this world lit class online. Fairly easy, but there was TONS of reading. I was broken up into fairly small sections, but there were like 5 books to go through, some more interesting than others. The class wasnt hard and should be an easy A

Professor Stewart is a very helpful, open-minded professor. I took her for an honors American Identities class that I looked forward to attending. Her classes relied upon discussion a lot, and reading essays and her projects were interesting and made me think. I'm glad I took her.

Prof. Stewart was marketed to me as an open minded, lenient, and helpful teacher. Over the course I discovered that she was petty, and unfailingly progressive. The head on this woman rivals any young poet and her assignments are vague, minutiae ridden, and bogus. Avoid at all costs.

I took her online section--it was awesome! There is a fair amount of reading to do, but all of the discussions and quizzes are easy if you do the work! She is very helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend to anyone. :)

This class was an absolute pleasure. I took it online and it was very flexible, easy, and simple. Professor Steward is very straight forward and is easy to work with. 6 DB's, 6 books, 2 short reflections, 6 quizes. Lowest quiz dropped if you take the last one and read the last book. I didn't think I would like this class as much as I did.

Four assignments that aren't explained very well, but you get to add your own interpretation.  Great class to get students comfortable with speaking in front of peers and students.  She has the class give positive feedback after every presentation.  I had a very fun, close group of people in this class.  Very fun and she is helpful when you ask.

Professor Stewart is amazing! She is so kind and sweet! Although you have to read about 5 - 7 books during the semester, they're pretty good books. We only had 3 quizzes and 3 reading responses. We have one big project and that's it. She's such a sweet lady and I would definitely take her again! My favorite professor at KSU!

Professor Stewart is a great teacher! It is a class based on presentations, which I was nervous about before class began. However, Prof Stewart made the entire class feel comfortable. By the end of the semester I felt more confident in my presentation skills. Their were a total of 4 presentations the semester. Take her class, you won't regret it!

I wish I'd checked this site before taking Stewart this semester and feel I could have been more "on the ball," so to speak, if I had. I'll say this: Stewart loves teaching. This is her passion, and if it's not yours, you will not do well in this class. If, however, you're ready to work, work, work, then Stewart will have much to teach you.

This class really teaches you how to be a comfortable and respectful presenter. Yes, she is a little passive-aggressive and yes, the work is a bit unclear. I believe the faults of this class, however, are the things that prepare you to be able to take projects into your hands and become a real teacher. Be respectful, participate, and just have fun!

I liked Stewart's class and ended up making an A. She IS snappy but don't talk when she is talking (didn't you learn that in middle school?) The workload is light and fun. My particular class had bad attitudes and she came down on them (hence the bad comments below). She is helpful at office hours. She can be unclear, just ask questions.

She expects respect but doesn't give it.  We are adults.  If one person is late the whole class is lectured. Doesn't give clear feedback or instructions. Like someone else said very condescending.  She talks down to you with a smile on her face like that makes it ok.  Hope I don't encounter her again.

This is the most condescending teacher I have ever had. She is rude when you ask for feedback and has never clearly explained anything that I have asked her. I will not take her again. Her class is about how you should present yourself when teaching, she needs to listen to herself.

great teacher. She is nice. I was surprised to see negatives on here. As long as you DO the work then you're going to be fine. It was mostly discussion in class and she lets you redo papers if your paper wasn't good. Definately taking her again

Ms. Stewart was fantastic.  I would take another class from her without thinking twice. I took her for 2271.  Once I was really nervous about doing a presentation and she sat with me one on one and made me feel so relaxed. She gives a lot of helpful feedback.  The only thing to watch for is that she hates when people don't pay attention in class!

I had Ms. Stewart for English 2271 and AMST 3700, and I loved both. That being said, it is unfair to the professor when a poster speaks for an entire class when posting on this site. Speak from your own experience with Ms. Stewart's class/es. She is a fantastic teacher and a great communicator. She is passionate about content, student achievement.

I don't get why she has good reviews... She's nice, and her class isn't hard, but she is the most confusing teacher I've ever had. My class and I walk in every day wondering what the heck the homework was and having no idea whether or not we did the projects right. She talks in circles and if you have questions you're better off asking your dog.
Mrs. Stewart is a great teacher.  ENGL 3310 has potential to be miserable, but she made it bearable.  I would take her again.  She's a stickler for attendance though.  Watch that.
No Comments

Kind and devoted teacher, incredibly helpful. Engaging literature selection, you will not be bored. Class is always interesting: small group discussions, DVD clips, some powerpoint. Small homework assignments and brief quizzes.

I thought I used to suck at writing papers but the first two that i wrote I got A's on. She also let's you revise them and turn them back in for a better grade.There is always an assignment to be working on, one to the next. allowed to pick your topics. Were required to do a presentation at the end. Overall,shes really nice, sometimes edgy attitude

I've written research papers for years but found no better instruction for how-to than this professor. Great instruction and guidance for finding and using academic research. This class will definitely improve your writing. Lots of groupwork, usually to collaborate and brainstorm or edit. Great class.
great teacher. definitely recommend. really cares about helping you out. a lot of reading. you have to talk a lot in class because thats all that goes on. interesting class overall. very nice prof.

Mrs. Stewart is an amazing professor.she really cared about her students and making the subject interesting. she uses pop culture references and talks about the material in context with how it relates to today. I didnt do much of the reading. Mostly just talk in class. I missed 2 classes and was ok. Just be sure to email her the same day and explai
She was such a sweet lady. Very willing to help you out if you need it... and she does play favorites but just say anything in class and you'll do fine
The class simply had too much unecessary work that she did not even ask in the exams . we had to read 9 books. her grading i very bad she has her favorites
I thought she was nice but some of my classmates hated her. 2 people failed and 5 or 6 got a C and the rest got an  A or B. Portfolio was extreeeemly hard. Stay on top of your work and you will pass.

Class structure didn't make sense at first, but just follow the rules and you'll do fine. YOU MUST TALK A LOT IN DISUCUSSIONS! Papers have no limits...you pick your topics!:) Helpful teacher.Very opinionated class. Show her you are putting effort in the class and she'll work with you. She hates slackers!! :) Would take her again.
Class was very hard and confusing
At first I did not like her, but once u get to know her she is cool. Just show some effort and do the reading and this should be an easy "A". She gets pissed if u miss alot of days though.
hate her, horrible teacher

Started the semester not liking her. But ended up loving her. I miss her still. She is upbeat and pretty funny.She made me feel as though she cared personally about my success,which made me care for her.Bottom line-cool lady,do the work,try a little and you should get an A like me.
No Comments

Prof. Stewart seemed decent at first, but quickly turned on me when I missed two days of class (excused by a dr). She pulled me out of class and told me how my health problems didn't matter to her, even though I said I'd make up the work. Ridiculous!
Really nice lady! You have to learn to write papers out of your norm, but I overall liked the class/professor!
Explains everything in detail.  She makes class fun. But she makes you learn and get down to bizness.  Difficult grader on papers but fair when comes to final grades.  I love her.
Too hard
She is a very nice lady and the content of the course is easy as long as you read.

I really enjoyed Ms. Stewarts class. Discussions and readings sometimes a little pointless. You have to work hard on your papers but she gives you a lot of freedom and there is great interaction amoung classmates. I had a lot of fun in her class.
No Comments

One of the nicest people you will ever meet!  She is always willing to help in any way, whether it has to do with her class or not.  She expects you to read and participate, but if you make an honest effort, you should be fine.
Professor Stewart was amazing!  I suggest her to anyone!  She is very interested in helping you, and she LISTENS to you... WONDERFUL PERSON AND TEACHER!!!!
She has been the best English teacher I have ever had! She let you pick your own topics so you could write about what intrested you. I would take her for any other classes she taught.

I loved this class.  Mrs Stewart makes the class interesting.  We did 2 papers and 1 project consisting of 6 different things to do.  She is always there for you if you need help and she give you a chance to revise any of your papers for a better grade.
